Utterance: Hi, it's Ellie again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie. I've been okay, I guess. Just trying to keep busy.
That's good to hear. Last time we talked about your uncle and how his passing has affected you. How have you been feeling about that recently?
Well, it still hurts, but I’m starting to find some peace with it. I think about him a lot, but I’m trying to focus on the good memories.
That sounds like a positive step. Are there any specific memories that bring you comfort?
Yeah, I remember all the times we would watch old movies together. He loved film noir too, and we’d spend hours talking about them.
It sounds like those shared moments were really special. Have you been able to watch any films lately?
I did! I watched "Double Indemnity" last week. It was like he was right there with me.
That’s wonderful. Keeping those connections alive can be really healing. Have you noticed any changes in your mood or motivation since our last talk?
I still feel a bit unmotivated, especially with work. Some days, I just don’t want to get out of bed.
I see. It’s understandable given everything you've been through. Have you been able to engage in any activities that usually bring you joy?
Not really. I’ve just been going through the motions. I know I should exercise or do something productive, but it feels like too much effort.
It sounds like you might be experiencing some symptoms of depression. Have you been able to discuss this with your doctor?
Not really. I just see them for medication refills. I don’t think they have the time to go deeper.
It’s important to have that deeper conversation. Would you be open to exploring some coping strategies together today?
Sure, I’m willing to try anything.
Great! One approach we can consider is setting small, achievable goals for yourself. What’s one small thing you could commit to this week?
Maybe I could go for a short walk a couple of times. That seems doable.
That sounds like a perfect start! Walking can really help lift your mood and clear your mind. How about we aim for two short walks this week?
Yeah, I can do that.
Awesome! And if you feel up to it, you could also try journaling about your feelings or your memories of your uncle.
I’ve never really journaled before, but I could give it a shot.
It doesn’t have to be anything formal. Just write down whatever comes to mind. It might help you process your emotions.
Okay, I’ll try that too.
Excellent! Remember to be gentle with yourself. It’s okay to have days where you don’t feel like doing much.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate that.
Of course! Is there anything else on your mind today?
Well, I’ve been thinking about my weight and how I want to lose some, but it’s hard to get motivated.
That’s a common struggle, especially when dealing with emotional pain. Would you like to explore some small steps you could take regarding that?
Yeah, I think that would help.
How about starting with a goal to incorporate a healthy snack into your day? Something simple like fruit or nuts.
That sounds manageable. I can do that.
Great! Let’s check in on that next time. Remember, small changes can lead to big results over time.
I’ll keep that in mind.
Before we wrap up, how do you feel about our session today?
I feel a bit lighter, actually. It’s nice to talk about things.
I’m glad to hear that. Remember, you’re not alone in this. I’m here to support you.
Thank you, Ellie. I really appreciate it.
You’re welcome! I look forward to hearing about your walks and journaling next time. Take care!
Bye, Ellie.
Bye!
